Title: Avatar
Original title: Avatar
Country: USA
USA release: 18/12/2009
Release in Spain: 18/12/2009
Released on DVD (rental): 21/04/2010
DVD release (sale): 21/04/2010
Blu-ray release: 21/04/2010
Studio: Twentieth Century Fox Film Corporation
Director: James Cameron
Screenplay: James Cameron
Cast: Sam Worthington, Zoe Saldana, Sigourney Weaver, Michelle Rodriguez, Giovanni Ribisi, Joel David Moore, CCH Pounder, Peter Mensah, Laz Alonso, Wes Studi, Stephen Lang, Matt Gerald
Rating: Not recommended for children under 7 years

Synopsis:
Avatar leads to a spectacular new world beyond our imagination where an unexpected hero embarks on an adventure, fighting to save a new alien world that has learned to call home.

We enter the new world through the eyes of Jake Sully, a former Marine confined to a wheelchair. Despite his crippled body, is still a warrior at heart. Jake has been recruited to travel to Pandora, where corporations are extracting a mineral is strange that the key to solving the problems of the Earth's energy crisis. To be toxic Pandora's atmosphere, they have created the Avatar program, in which human "drivers" have their minds together to an avatar, a biological body remotely controlled can survive in the deadly air. These avatars are created genetically mixed human DNA with DNA from the natives of Pandora ... the Na'vi.

As early as avatar, Jake can walk again. Has the mission to infiltrate between Na'vi, which have become the major obstacle to extract the mineral. But a beautiful Na'vi, Naytiri, saves the life of Jake, and everything changes. Jake admitted to his clan and learn to be one of them, which makes it subject to many trials and adventures. According to Jake's relationship with his teacher Neytiry be intensified, he learns to respect the lives of Na'vi and decides to find his place among them. Soon will face more tests when I have to address an epic battle that will decide nothing less than the fate of his new world.

Production notes:
- Winner of Best Film at the 1st edition of the League of film 'The Seventh Art' (2009).
- In just over a month on the bill has become the highest grossing film worldwide, including Spain.
